channel.title: CVE Feed for Adobe -- InDesign Desktop
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Adobe -- InDesign Desktop

item.title: CVE-2024-20781|2024-07-09T19:18:42.013Z -- adobe -- indesign%20desktop
item.description: InDesign Desktop versions ID19.3, ID18.5.2 and earlier are affected by a Heap-based Buffer Overflow vulnerability that could result in arbitrary code execution in the context of the current user. Exploitation of this issue requires user interaction in that a victim must open a malicious file.

item.title: CVE-2024-20783|2024-07-09T19:32:32.066Z -- adobe -- indesign%20desktop
item.description: InDesign Desktop versions ID19.3, ID18.5.2 and earlier are affected by a Heap-based Buffer Overflow vulnerability that could result in arbitrary code execution in the context of the current user. Exploitation of this issue requires user interaction in that a victim must open a malicious file.

item.title: CVE-2024-20782|2024-07-09T19:32:42.798Z -- adobe -- indesign%20desktop
item.description: InDesign Desktop versions ID19.3, ID18.5.2 and earlier are affected by an out-of-bounds write vulnerability that could result in arbitrary code execution in the context of the current user. Exploitation of this issue requires user interaction in that a victim must open a malicious file.

item.title: CVE-2024-20785|2024-07-09T19:32:16.131Z -- adobe -- indesign%20desktop
item.description: InDesign Desktop versions ID19.3, ID18.5.2 and earlier are affected by a Heap-based Buffer Overflow vulnerability that could result in arbitrary code execution in the context of the current user. Exploitation of this issue requires user interaction in that a victim must open a malicious file.

item.title: CVE-2024-20766|2024-06-06T13:47:53.906Z -- adobe -- indesign%20desktop
item.description: InDesign Desktop versions 18.5.1, 19.2 and earlier are affected by an out-of-bounds read vulnerability that could lead to disclosure of sensitive memory. An attacker could leverage this vulnerability to bypass mitigations such as ASLR. Exploitation of this issue requires user interaction in that a victim must open a malicious file.
